required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fluid Management for Cesarean Section II
clinical_study.official_title: Fluid Management for Cesarean Section Undergoing Spinal Anesthesia

collaborator.agency: Nanjing Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Fluid management plays an essential role in cesarean section. In previous study (NCT00488111) the investigators found that prior-epidural anesthesia fluid management produced a more significant role in stabilizing the blood pressure and better prognosis after cesarean delivery than that of the posterior-anesthesia ones. Given epidural anesthesia has a time interval before reaching the best state of anesthesia, so the fluid management also has a relatively adequate time to resuscitation. In reality, spinal anesthesia is used popularly except for the epidural anesthesia, whereas spinal anesthesia would produce more significant fluctuation of the hemodynamics compared with the latter. Herein the investigators proposed whether the prior-spinal anesthesia fluid management also produced similar effect on hemodynamic characteristics to the epidural anesthesia.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Anesthesia begin (0 min) to 120 min after anesthesia

secondary_outcome.measure: Recurrence of hypotension after ephedrine or phenylephrine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Anesthesia begin (0 min) to 120 min after anesthesia
Anesthesia begin (0 min) to 120 min after anesthesia

secondary_outcome.measure: Total volume of colloid or crystalloid
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Fifteen minutes before anesthesia to 120 min after anesthesia
The first and fifth minute after cesarean successful delivery
Anesthesia begin (0 min) to 120 min after anesthesia
Anesthesia begin (0 min) to 120 min after anesthesia
At the time of successful delivery (0 min)

arm_group.description: Crystalloid (Ringer's Lactate) was given before spinal anesthesia
Crystalloid (Ringer's Lactate) was given after spinal anesthesia
Colloid (6% hydroxyethyl starch) was given before spinal anesthesia
Colloid (6% hydroxyethyl starch) was given after spinal anesthesia

intervention.description: Ringer's Lactate 8 ml/kg was given intravenously before or after spinal anesthesia in cesarean section
Hydroxyethyl starch (6%) was given before or after spinal anesthesia in cesarean section

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 21-40 yr
- First time of delivery
- ASA status I-II
- No premature
- No genetic and infectious diseases
- Chinese
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 21 yr
- > 40 yr
- Subjects with cardiac and pulmonary disorders
- Dislocation of placenta
- Pregnant hypertension
- Allergy to local anesthetics
- Unwilling to cooperation
- Need intraoperative administration of vascular active agents
- With significant delivery side effects

facility.name: The Affiliated Nanjing Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital
